content.description:
PERCENT OF LAND USED FOR AGRICULTURE, FOR SELECTED REGIONS

Source: Food and Agriculture Organization

The graph shows trends in the percent of each regionâ€™s total land area used for agriculture.
content.question:
A. Using the graph, compare the trend lines for the region of Europe and the region of the Middle East and North Africa for the 1981 to 2001 time period.

B. Explain how agricultural land use change has affected the agricultural density of Europe.

C. Explain how the intensity of farming practices in a region can have variable effects on environmental sustainability.

D. Using the region of the Middle East and North Africa, explain how some countries have become highly dependent on one or more imported commodities from other regions.

frqParts.text:
A. Using the graph, compare the trend lines for the region of Europe and the region of the Middle East and North Africa for the 1981 to 2001 time period.

B. Explain how agricultural land use change has affected the agricultural density of Europe.

C. Explain how the intensity of farming practices in a region can have variable effects on environmental sustainability.

D. Using the region of the Middle East and North Africa, explain how some countries have become highly dependent on one or more imported commodities from other regions.

unit.text: 5: Agriculture and Rural Land-Use Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Compare patterns and trends in maps and in quantitative and geospatial data to draw conclusions.
